#Text=Plan a Christmas Marketing Campaign
#Text=Retailers can expect a jaw-dropping $ 68.9 billion in sales over the holiday period as consumers spend up big on holiday gifts for family friends , according to new research from IBISWorld .
#Text=But as one of the busiest periods of the year fast approaches , what are you doing to maximize the holiday shopping rush for your business ?
#Text=The holiday season is an ideal time for brands to kick into gear and step up any marketing or promotional activities .
#Text=It ’s the time of year when people are prepared to spend , and are looking for the right opportunity to do so .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Determine your campaign strategy .
#Text=So how do you create a good campaign for Christmas ?

#Text=UK retailer John Lewis has received an overwhelming response to its 2013 Christmas Advert ; the YouTube video has been watched more than 9 million times and generated an impressive amount of social chatter .
#Text=This complemented a traditional media campaign .
#Text=Moz blogger James Porter looked at what made this campaign successful .
#Text=Sure it was an expensive campaign , but there ’s lessons to be learned , even if you ’ve only got a small budget .
#Text=Porter suggests one of the reasons the campaign has done so well is that it was created specifically for the channels where potential customers are located .
#Text=In fact , the campaign was n’t even launched on the John Lewis website — it was launched first on Twitter and YouTube .
#Text=Start planning your campaign as early as possible to maximize potential to reach your customers .
#Text=One of our favorite campaigns this year came from Coke Zero , and launched almost six weeks out from Christmas .
#Text=The company created an online sweater generator , and asked people to create their own tacky Christmas jumpers .
#Text=Coca-Cola got some great coverage of their promotion ( FastCo , PSFK , AdWeek and others ) and generated lots of social media buzz .
#Text=Update your marketing collateral .
#Text=Christmas is the perfect time to refresh your marketing materials .
#Text=If you are a retailer , try developing a Christmas gift guide or updating your branding with a seasonal look and feel .
#Text=For service businesses , think about how you can tap into the holiday buzz .
#Text=Hairdressers could try to target people who want to look their best at their Christmas party , while carpenters may offer a special package to anyone wanting work done before the holidays .
#Text=You can build your own Christmas branding and extend it to Facebook , Twitter , and your website .
#Text=This is something that ’s easy to do , yet increases awareness of your holiday promotion .
#Text=There are lots of other ways to get into the festive spirit .
#Text=Here are a couple simple ideas :
#Text=Holiday gift guide .
#Text=Putting together a holiday gift guide can be a great way to promote your holiday promotional activities .
#Text=Online clothing retailer ASOS has created a special splash page for the holidays and produced a number of snappy Youtube videos with great gifting tips .
#Text=Seasonal company information .
#Text=Are you extending your opening hours over Christmas ?
#Text=Or if you ’re online only , have you got deadlines for Christmas orders to be delivered ?
#Text=Updating your customers with this information keeps them in the loop .
#Text=It ’s also a good excuse to reach out to your existing customers .
#Text=Christmas vouchers .
#Text=An impressive 61 % of gift card holders spend more than the amount of the card .
#Text=You can use this knowledge to boost Christmas sales .
#Text=Another tip is to use ‘ artificial advancement ‘ in any loyalty programs you offer .
#Text=Research shows a pre-stamped loyalty card results in better customer loyalty .
#Text=Make your customers feel extra special .
#Text=What are you doing to make your existing customers feel special ?
#Text=Online store provider Shopify argues that the best selling proposition , particularly for small companies , is amazing customer service .
#Text=The holiday season provides the perfect excuse to do something nice for your customers .
#Text=Offering customers a small gift or freebie can be a nice way to say thanks to people have supported your brand during the year , and also encourage them to come back again .
#Text=Another way to do this is to organize an event for your biggest supporters .
#Text=You could even host a VIP sale night or put on some Christmas drinks .
